tool.name: review_consite

param.name: auto_CS
param.dialogReference: Feature layer or feature class containing the NEW (typically automated) Conservation Sites

param.name: orig_CS
param.dialogReference: Feature layer or feature class containing the OLD, original Conservation Sites (as exported from Biotics)

param.name: cutVal
param.dialogReference: The cutoff value (percent) used to determine if old and new sites are significantly different. This is applicable only to sites for which there is a one-to-one relationship between old and new sites.

param.name: out_Sites
param.displayname: Output new Conservation Sites feature class with QC fields
param.dialogReference: Output feature class containing the new Conservation Sites. This will have the same geometry as the input NEW sites, but with additional attributes appended.

param.name: fld_SiteID
param.dialogReference: The field in the OLD Conservation Sites layer containing the unique Site ID for each site.

param.name: scratch_GDB
param.dialogReference:
Scratch geodatabase specified to store temporary/intermediate data.

If not specified, intermediate data will be stored in memory and will not persist; this is preferred for faster processing. It is recommended that you only specify a scratch geodatabase if you need to trouble-shoot poor automation results, or if your computer has insufficient memory for processing large datasets.

tool.summary:
Submits new (typically automated) Conservation Site features to a Quality Control procedure, comparing new to existing (old) shapes from the previous production cycle. It determines which of the following applies to each updated site:

  • N: Site is new, not corresponding to any old site.

  • I: Site is identical to an old site.

  • M: Site is a merger of two or more old sites.

  • S: Site is one of several that split off from an old site.

  • C: Site is a combination of merger(s) and split(s)

  • B: Boundary change only. Site corresponds directly to an old site, but the boundary has changed to some extent.

For the last group of sites (B), determines how much the boundary has changed. A "PercDiff" field contains the percentage difference in area between old and new shapes. The area that differs is determined by ArcGIS's Symmetrical Difference tool. The user specifies a threshold beyond which the difference is deemed "significant".

Finally, adds additional fields for QC purposes, and flags records that should be examined by a human (all N, M, S, and C sites, plus any B sites with change greater than the threshold).

In the output feature class, the output geometry is identical to the input new Conservation Sites, but attributes have been added for QC purposes. The added attributes are as follows:

  • ModType: Text field indicating how the site has been modified, relative to existing old sites. Values are "N", "M", "S", "C, "I", or "B" as described above.

  • PercDiff: Numeric field indicating the percent difference between old and new boundaries, as described above. Applies only to sites where ModType = "B".

  • AssignID: Text field containing the old Site ID associated with the new site. This field is automatically populated only for sites where ModType is "B" or "I". For other sites, the ID should be manually assigned during site review. Attributes associated with this ID may be transferred, in whole or in part, from the old site to the new site.

  • Flag: Short integer field indicating whether the new site needs to be examined by a human (1) or not (0). All sites where ModType is "N", "M", "S", or "C" are flagged automatically. Sites where ModType = "B" are flagged if the value in the PercDiff field is greater than the user-specified threshold.

  • Comment: Text field to be used by site reviewers to enter comments. Nothing is entered automatically.

For the last group of sites (B), determines how much the boundary has changed. A "PercDiff" field contains the percentage difference in area between old and new shapes. For other sites, the ID should be manually assigned during site review. Attributes associated with this ID may be transferred, in whole or in part, from the old site to the new site.
